Desc.entry: Part of Sheffield Libraries, Archives and Information. Provides a reception, reference and information service on all aspects of business, science, technology, arts, humanities, social sciences, sports, climbing including the Alan Rouse Climbing Collection, and community information including local groups and events. Includes health, materials, metals and metallurgy, cookery, gardening, consumer reports including Which?, government publications, law including Acts of Parliament, radio and television servicing information, education and careers, social issues, maps and travel, genealogy, film and television, charities, government publications, parliamentary information, census, statistics, newspapers, periodicals, car test reports and workshop manuals. Special collections include UK company financial details on FAME database, UK company Annual Reports collection, British and foreign technical standards, British and Community Trade Marks, patents collection (member of the PATLIB UK), European Public Information Centre, collection of European leaflets and British and overseas business directories (including Kompass Worldwide database). UK telephone directories and Yellow Pages. UK and overseas statistics collection. Market research databases, Marketline and Mintel Global Market Navigator. Trade and technical journals. Hosts a free monthly patent clinic and a free monthly inventors group meeting. Able to give talks to groups on specific resources available within Reception, Reference and Information, please contact for advance booking. A computer suite with over 20 computers is available for use by the public and library users. Scanner and printer available.
